Esmeralda || Carlos Padilla, Sr., Maria Clara Ruiz, Angelita Rey, Quiel Segovia, Alfredo Javier, Teddy Benavidez || Parlatone Hispano Filipino || || |- | | 1937 |- |Zamboanga aka Fury In Paradise|| Eduardo de Castro || Fernando Poe, Sr., Rosa del Rosario|| Filippine Productions || Drama, Romance || English subtitle: Fury in Paradise; This film was deemed lost after World War II. However, the film was recently found in Finland, and the film was repatriated to the Philippines. It was shown in 2004 to celebrate the Filipino cinema's 85th anniversary. The creation of Filippine Productions by the producers on this film led to the institution of the Philippine studio system which sees the emergence of movie studios such as Lebran, LVN, Premiere and Sampaguita possible. This is the start of the golden age in Philippine cinema. This film was first telecast on New York City's pioneer television station W2XBS on July 4, 1940. |- |Sampaguitang Walang Bango|| || Leopoldo Salcedo || Filippine Productions || || |- |Nasaan Ka Irog|| Carlos Vander Tolosa || Elsa Oria, Angel Esmeralda, Tito Arevalo, Prima Vera, SSS Trio, Troubadours Moonlight, Bimbo Danao, Orchestra Symphony Parlatone, Nati Rubi, Billy Surot Viscarra, Mila del Sol || Parlatone Hispano Filipino || Drama, Musical || Mila del Sol was introduced in this movie |- |Ilaw Ng Langit|| Tor Villano || Manuel Barbeyto, Jose Padilla, Jr., Rosita Rivera || || Drama || |- |Mga Pusong Dakila|| || Teddy Benavidez, Gerardo de Leon, Angel Esmeralda, Rosario Moreno, Lina Violeta || || Drama || |- |Asahar at Kabaong|| Gregorio Fernandez || Rosa del Rosario, Jose Padilla, Jr., Gregorio Fernandez, Angelita Rey, Consuelo Ruiz || Filippine Productions || || |- |Brides of Sulu|| John Nelson || James J.
